title: The US Space Force plans to start patrolling the area around the Moon
summary: "Until now, the United States space mission extended 22,000 miles above Earth."

title: Roscosmos head again questions future of ISS while NASA emphasizes cooperation
summary: The head of Roscosmos has renewed threats to terminate Russian participation in the International Space Station even as NASA says operations on the station remain normal.

title: “Nothing to share”: South Korean firm turns down Ukrainian request for satellite imagery
summary: South Korea’s Earth observation company SI Imaging Services (SIIS) turned down a request to share satellite imagery of Ukraine and neighboring countries to assist Ukrainian efforts to repel Russia’s invasion.

title: NASA awards SpaceX three additional commercial crew missions
summary: NASA ordered three more commercial crew missions to the International Space Station from SpaceX Feb. 28 at a price of more than three-quarters of a billion dollars.

title: SpaceX preps for another Starlink launch as internet terminals arrive in Ukraine
summary: SpaceX wheeled a Falcon 9 rocket and 47 internet satellites to a launch pad Wednesday at Kennedy Space Center, ready to blast off Thursday to reinforce the Starlink constellation days after SpaceX expanded the network into Ukraine amid Russia’s invasion of the country.

title: OneWeb leaves Baikonur Cosmodrome after Roscosmos ultimatum
summary: OneWeb ordered staff to leave Russia's Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan on Wednesday amid an impasse over the launch of its latest batch of satellites on a Soyuz rocket, an executive for the U.K.-based company said.

title: Satellite images show Russia’s troop movements but can they reveal intent?
summary: Commercial spy satellites provides extraordinary intelligence about Russian troop advances in Ukraine and attacks on Ukrainian cities. But as the conflict grinds on, intelligence analysts at times are still being challenged to figure out Russian intent.

title: Skycorp to test “USB for space” cable outside ISS
summary: Skycorp Inc., a California company focused on orbital logistics, is preparing to test a key component of future satellite servicing vehicles on the International Space Station.

title: Russia issues ultimatum to UK government over OneWeb launch
summary: Russia’s space agency said Wednesday it will not launch a batch of 36 OneWeb satellites this week unless the UK government gives up its stake in the satellite internet company, a prospect the UK business secretary later confirmed won’t happen.

title: Moon impact: Chinese rocket stage still in space says U.S. Space Command
summary: A spent rocket upper stage from China’s 2014 Chang’e-5 T1 mission thought set to impact the moon did not reenter the atmosphere as previously stated, according to U.S. Space Command.
